title: Helping a friend out-
content:
Top one: maybe Farao by Bruhn?   
Bottom one is just an abused Frutiger. :-)
author: Eduardo Omine

comments.content: [FTN Farao](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524123207/http:/www.veer.com/results.asp?Image=FOT0000065) isn't as distressed as the example above. I'd argue that it's probably some PC TrueType freeware face found online somewhere.

"I'd argue that it's probably some PC TrueType freeware face found online somewhere."   
   
I would have to agree.   
   
hildebrant.

well, if you want my opinion....   
to bad your gonna get it anyways   
I agree with Grant, Kyle and Yves. I have lots of those goofy freeware fonts and thought it matched right in with some of them I have.

Have never seen the top one as a free font.   
   
Jared, what does your friend need it for?   
   
Reason I ask because you can distress an Egyptian   
Slab Serif, streamline it, and send her some   
vector outlines in a relatively quick amount of time.   
   
bj

a few places to look   
   
 [www.misprintedtype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524123207/http:/www.misprintedtype.com/)   
   
 [www.cape-arcona.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524123207/http:/www.cape-arcona.com/)   
   
 [www.garagefonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524123207/http:/www.garagefonts.com/)   
   
 [www.chank.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524123207/http:/www.chank.com/) (stomper, goshen)   
   
 [www.chankarmy.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524123207/http:/www.chankarmy.com/)   
   
 [www.formsubstance.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524123207/http:/www.formsubstance.com/) (stampkit)   
   
looks like the fonts are no longer available for download.   
   
   
I'm sure everyone has diff. ways to go grunge....here are a few   
things from Googlel   
   
 [www.macdesignonline.com/tutorials/photoshop/marapr03\_texture.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524123207/http:/www.macdesignonline.com/tutorials/photoshop/marapr03_texture.html)   
   
 [www.sitepointforums.com/showthread.php?threadid=113175](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524123207/http:/www.sitepointforums.com/showthread.php?threadid=113175)   
   
And Yves posted his method a few months back.   
   
bj

I forgot the folks at One Way Out.   
   
Lots of grungy stuff there, too.   
   
 [www.churchartworks.com/fonts/font.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524123207/http:/www.churchartworks.com/fonts/font.html)
